articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: An engineer is tapping artificial intelligence to revolutionize how documents are read and how information is gathered.
articles.title: New AI Tool Named for Warren Buffett Makes Quick Work of Corporate Filings

articles.description: Brands like Dolce & Gabbana and Gucci will display their digital wares in an event spanning three metaverse platforms. Here's how it will work.
articles.title: Metaverse Fashion Week 2023 Goes Multi-Platform in Push for Interoperability

articles.description: The exchange says it still wants to work with regulators to establish clear guidelines.
articles.title: ‘Unexpected and Disappointing’: Binance Reacts to CFTC Lawsuit

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Nvidia caters to gamers, but also sells hardware explicitly designed for crypto mining. Now its CTO is slamming crypto and pushing AI instead.
articles.title: Nvidia Says Crypto Adds Nothing to Society, Despite Profiting From Mining

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: The Ethereum creator was described as a “man of culture” after setting the gas limit on the network’s first-ever transaction to "69042."
articles.title: Vitalik Buterin Sends Hidden Message in First Polygon zkEVM Transaction

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Luxury fashion brand Gucci is taking further steps into Web3 with Yuga Labs, with first plans set to get underway this week.
articles.title: Gucci Reveals Metaverse Tie-Up With Bored Ape Creator Yuga Labs

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: After developing the feature with the metal band, Ticketmaster is offering artists a token-gated option for exclusive ticket access.
articles.title: Ticketmaster Debuts NFT-Gated Ticket Sales, Starting With Avenged Sevenfold

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The regulator's lawsuit alleges that Binance violated derivative trading rules in the U.S.
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Fall as CFTC Sues Binance and CEO Changpeng Zhao

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: A recent filing with the SEC revealed that Microstrategy has conveniently paid off its loan with the failed Silvergate Bank.
articles.title: MicroStrategy Repays Silvergate Loan, Spends $150M Buying More Bitcoin

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: It’s the final mainnet from Polygon, but co-founder Mihailo Bjelic advises proceeding with caution when using the new zkEVM.
articles.title: Polygon Launches Final Mainnet for zkEVM Solution to Scale Ethereum

articles.author: Mattis Meichler
articles.description: After SushiSwap, DeFi exchange dYdX is also making the leap to Cosmos, citing slow transaction speeds on Ethereum.
articles.title: dYdX Reveals Launch Date for Move From Ethereum to Cosmos

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: The “Skull of Satoshi” creator said Bitcoin's environmental impact is not “a simple black-and-white” issue” as he originally believed.
articles.title: 'Skull of Satoshi' Artist Says He Was 'Wrong' About Bitcoin Mining

articles.author: Alys Key
articles.description: Silicon Valley Bank's acquisition affirms First Citizens' "commitment to support the integrity of our nation's banking system," said its CEO.
articles.title: First Citizens Bank Enters Deal With FDIC to Buy Silicon Valley Bank

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Testimony in Aiden Pleterski’s case tells a familiar story of fraud, with harrowing consequences.
articles.title: Canada’s Bankrupt ‘Crypto King’ Kidnapped, Tortured, Held for $3 Million Ransom

articles.description: Brandon Riley paid 77 Ethereum for the NFT, then irreversibly destroyed it.
articles.title: NFT Trader Accidentally Burns $129K CryptoPunk

articles.description: The sale "will restart with a more equitable and diverse group of artists at a later date."
articles.title: Sotheby's Pauses NFT Auction After Glitch Artist Withdraws Over Lack of Female Artists

articles.description: Also, Coinbase critics challenge its compliance claims, and footage of Do Kwon's arrest in Montenegro went viral.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Bitcoin Miami Mocked by Maxis, Bitcoiners Embrace Anti-Bitcoin Art

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: “LeeMullican.PCX” captures the late artist’s transition from palette knife to mouse and stylus when he was in his late 60s.
articles.title: Painter Lee Mullican’s Pioneering 1987 Digital Art Released via Tezos NFTs

articles.author: Mason Marcobello
articles.description: Stealth addresses offer a method of privacy similar to generating a new address for each transaction but without the hassle of manually creating those addresses each time.
articles.title: What Are Stealth Addresses?

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: As investors rushed to leading cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, politicians in the United States took aim at incoming CBDC plans.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Investors Rehash Bitcoin's 'Safe-Haven' Status as DeSantis Takes Aim at CBDCs

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: As new DAOs emerge left and right, figuring out how they stack up against one another is often an apples-to-oranges job for analysts.
articles.title: All Centralized Firms Are Alike—But Every DAO Is Decentralized in Its Own Way

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: The banking network collapse from earlier this month poses a significant risk to the health of the crypto market.
articles.title: Bitcoin Liquidity Hits 10-Month Low Amid US Banking Crisis

articles.description: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.
articles.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet

articles.author: Andrew Throuvalas
articles.description: ARK invest sold Coinbase shares on Tuesday, then bought an even larger haul on Thursday after word of the SEC's warning tanked the price.
articles.title: Cathie Wood Buys the Dip on Coinbase Stock Two Days After Dumping

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Neil Gaiman and the Winklevoss twins are among the subjects in Aversano's tarot-inspired photo set, exhibiting in Los Angeles from Saturday.
articles.title: From ‘Twin Flames’ to Tarot: Justin Aversano Exhibits ‘Smoke and Mirrors’ Photo NFTs

articles.description: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved

articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.description: The moves come amidst an anti-corruption investigation that has brought an arrest, resignation, and a national scandal.
articles.title: Venezuela Regulator Shuts Down Some Cryptocurrency Exchanges and Mining Farms

articles.description: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.
articles.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Most of the eligible users of the popular Ethereum scaling solution didn’t wait to claim the free Arbitrum (ARB) tokens.
articles.title: Arbitrum Settles Into Top 40 Coins With 81% of Airdrop Claimed

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov,Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: The Bitcoin community turned the "Skull of Satoshi" installation into a new meme while ridiculing the idea of abandoning proof-of-work.
articles.title: ‘Badass’: Greenpeace’s New ‘Skull of Satoshi’ Artwork Is a Hit With Bitcoin Fans

articles.author: Andrew Cohen
articles.description: This new version of Tarzan is ready to leave the jungle, don some accessories, and show up across an array of Web3 game worlds.
articles.title: Tarzan Swings Into the Metaverse With Official NFT Drop

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: After four years of building and multiple milestones, zkSync is finally launching its Ethereum scaling solution to the public.
articles.title: Ethereum Scaling Solution zkSync Launches Alpha Mainnet

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Revolving Games, a studio backed by Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser, has partnered with Overlord for its Creepz NFT-inspired game.
articles.title: Web3 Studio Overlord Taps Dan Houser-Backed Revolving Games for NFT Game

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The number of Bitcoin Ordinals has passed 550,000 as interest in digital collectibles is ignited by copies of a blue-chip NFT line.
articles.title: Ordinals Fees Spike as Bored Ape Yacht Club Clones Bloom on Bitcoin

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The startup’s offer falls just short of the failed exchange’s $102 million investment.
articles.title: Mysten Labs to Buy $96 Million In Shares and Token Warrants Back From FTX

articles.description: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
articles.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The emerging A.I. market, riding high on mainstream hype, is estimated to reach $196 billion in 2023.
articles.title: Andreessen Horowitz Invests in Chatbot Startup Character AI

articles.author: Mattis Meichler
articles.description: After NFTs and the metaverse, some luxury brands are turning to blockchain technology to improve the lifecycle of their wares.
articles.title: Blockchain Offers 'Better Repair and Care Services' for Luxury Products: LVMH CIO

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: Block "misled investors on key metrics, and embraced predatory offerings" to fuel its growth amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the report alleges.
articles.title: Block Stock Dives on Short-Seller Report Claiming It 'Misled Investors'

articles.author: Decrypt Staff
articles.description: Commerce and engagement tool Dispatch is making Web3 interactions as simple and streamlined as clicking on a web ad.
articles.title: How Web3 Will Evolve the Way Businesses Connect With Customers

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: South Korean authorities had previously issued Terra's co-founder and CEO Do Kwon an arrest warrant last September.
articles.title: Do Kwon Arrested in Montenegro, Says Country’s Minister of Interior

articles.author: Decrypt Staff
articles.description: Circle stablecoins USDC and the newly-listed EUROC can now be bought and sold on Bittrex Global for no extra cost.
articles.title: Bittrex Global Offers No-Fee Trading on USDC and EUROC Markets

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: The highly-anticipated Arbitrum airdrop has finally gone live. Amid the hype, though, the project's homepage has crashed.
articles.title: Arbitrum Foundation Homepage Crashes as Users Rush to Claim ARB Tokens

articles.description: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.
articles.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris

articles.description: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.
articles.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris

articles.description: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Changpeng Zhao, CEO of the world’s largest crypto exchange Binance, has responded to the scathing lawsuit against his firm by the CFTC.
articles.title: Binance CEO Responds to ‘Unexpected and Disappointing’ CFTC Lawsuit

articles.title: Voyager's $1B sale to Binance.US put on hold by US court

articles.title: BlockFi to provide over $100K in refunds to California clients

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
Market strategist Jeremy Grantham, co-founder of asset management firm GMO, has warned of “super bubbles” bursting. He explained that the Federal Reserve has “created an environment conducive to a chain-linked series of super bubbles that break with outrageously consequential, painful effects.”
 
Jeremy Grantham’s Warnings
 
Investment strategist Jeremy Grantham shared his U.S. economic outlook with economist David Rosenberg during a Rosenberg Research webcast, published on March 16. Grantham is a co-founder and chief investment strategist of asset management firm GMO. He has been an investment strategist for over 40 years and has served on the investment boards of several non-profit organizations.
 
Grantham criticized the Federal Reserve for repeatedly causing asset bubbles. He noted tha…
articles.title: Market Strategist Discusses ‘Super Bubbles’ Bursting — Warns of ‘Outrageously Consequential, Painful Effects’

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: Are bitcoin traders shrugging off the CFTC's action against Binance? Or is there just not enough liquidity to go around?

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
Polygon Labs has recently made a major announcement that is set to impact the Ethereum network’s future positively. The protocol has launched Polygon zero-knowledge proof Ethereum Virtual Machine (zkEVM) on mainnet Beta, a permissionless and public network allowing users to transact and build. 
 
According to the announcement, to further support the protocol’s development, Polygon zkEVM is now completely open-source. With this launch, Polygon is allegedly helping to pave the way for the next chapter of Ethereum’s development and offering developers and users a new tool for building decentralized applications. 
 
 
What Are The Benefits Of Polygons’s New zkEVM?
 
The Polygon zkEVM is a zero-knowledge proof (ZPK) scaling solution developed by the same protocol, designed to enable faster and …
articles.title: Polygon Launches zkEVM Mainnet Beta, Will It Reduce Costs Of Ethereum Transactions?

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
The CEO of investment management firm Vaneck has predicted a bull cycle for gold and bitcoin. “We are at the very beginnings of what could be a several-year cycle in gold, and I also put bitcoin in that category as well,” the executive said, adding that the Federal Reserve is “close to the end of their tightening.”
 
Bull Cycle for Gold and Bitcoin
 
Jan van Eck, CEO of investment management firm Vaneck, shared his prediction regarding gold and bitcoin in an interview with CNBC last week. His firm has $69 billion in assets under management.
 
When asked whether gold, at its present levels, should be viewed as an investment or a temporary trade that may yield additional profits, he replied:
 

We are at the very beginnings of what could be a several-year cycle in gold, and I also put bitcoi…
articles.title: Vaneck CEO Predicts Bull Cycle for Bitcoin and Gold — Expects Fed Tightening to End Soon

articles.author: James Rubin
articles.description: In a blog post, Changpeng Zhao wrote that the company did not agree with “the characterization of many of the issues, and touted the exchange’s compliance technology. He also wrote that he had only two Binance accounts.
articles.title: Binance CEO Zhao Calls CFTC Suit an ‘Incomplete Recitation of Facts’

articles.author: Best Owie
articles.description:
It’s no secret that the bear market has affected every section of the crypto industry. The onslaught has seen both top cryptocurrencies and NFTs decline drastically from their 2021 all-time highs, and are now trading for a small percentage of this value. However, some have performed better compared to others. In this report, we’ll take a look at both the top NFTs (Blue Chips) and the top cryptocurrencies by market cap and see how well they have performed compared to one another.
 
Blue Chip NFTs Vs. Top Cryptocurrencies
 
When talking about blue-chip NFTs, they’re quite easy to spot. These are the NFTs that have been able to reach a high value and were able to maintain their value without wild fluctuations. In a way, they tend to work like the top 10 cryptocurrencies that have had a better…
articles.title: Comparing The Performance Of Blue Chip NFTs To Top Cryptocurrencies

articles.author: Nikhilesh De
articles.description: A federal judge paused Voyager's efforts to sell its assets to Binance.US in response to the U.S. government's filing for an emergency stay.
articles.title: Judge Puts Voyager Sale to Binance.US on Hold Pending Government Appeal

articles.author: Reynaldo Marquez
articles.description:
Today, the U.S. Commodities and Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) filed a lawsuit against crypto exchange Binance and its CEO, Changpeng “CZ” Zhao. The regulator is accusing the executive and the company of allegedly violating trading rules in the country.
 
 
In an official blog post, Zhao replied to the complaint and classified them as “unexpected” and “disappointing.” The executive claims that the company has worked with the U.S. regulator since 2021. Zhao said:
 

(…) the complaint appears to contain an incomplete recitation of facts, and we do not agree with the characterization of many of the issues alleged in the complaint.
 
 
Binance CEO Eats The Company’s “Dog Food”?
 
Zhao breakdown the charges, including Binance’s capacity to enforce compliance with U.S. trading rules. The cryp…
articles.title: Crypto Giant Binance In Hot Water: CEO Responds To Trading Violation Claims

articles.author: anushsamal
articles.description:
Input Output Global (IOG) is a software research and development company that played an imperative role in developing the blockchain platform Cardano. In its recent announcement, the company appointed Eran Barak as the CEO of its latest data-protection protocol, Midnight.
 
This new protocol is set to offer new features that mainly comprise advanced security features to improve the privacy and protection of users’ data on the Cardano network. This recent move from IOG is targeted to strengthen its position in the blockchain industry by meeting the growing demand for data protection and security concerns.
 
 
Eran Barak has had a successful career in the financial services industry, serving in multiple senior roles. Before being named the CEO of IOG’s new data-protection protocol, Midnight,…
articles.title: Former Symphony COO Joins IOG As CEO Of New Cardano Blockchain Project

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Despite Bitcoin’s difficulty reaching an all-time high at 46.84 trillion, participants in bitcoin mining have kept the hashrate running stronger than ever before. According to statistics, on March 23, 2023, the hashrate reached a high of 400 exahash per second (EH/s). The 400 exahash equates to 0.4 zettahash or four hundred quintillion hashes per second. As the hashrate continues to climb, research analyst Sam Wouters at River Financial estimates that at the current growth rate, Bitcoin could reach the zettahash era “by the end of 2025.”
 
Reasons for the Increase in Bitcoin Hashrate: Insights from River Financial Analyst
 
Two days ago, Bitcoin.com News reported that the difficulty of the Bitcoin network had increased for the third consecutive time in the last six weeks. The difficulty is…
articles.title: Bitcoin Hashrate Reaches 400 Exahash per Second, Researcher Says Network Could Reach Zettahash Era by 2025

articles.author: Tony "The Bull"
articles.description:
Litecoin was deemed a commodity today in a CFTC lawsuit filing against Binance.
 
With the altcoin now potentially safe from further scrutiny from the SEC, a new digital silver narrative could take shape. Here’s why.
 
Litecoin Officially Labeled A Commodity By US CFTC
 
The crypto market bled more than $50 billion in market cap today, after it was revealed that Binance and CEO Changpeng Zhao will face legal action from the United States Commodity Futures Trading Commission “over alleged trading and derivatives rules violations.”
 
According to the filing, the CFTC has explicitly named Litecoin, along with Bitcoin and Ethereum, to be a commodity under their jurisdiction. The CFTC is in charge of regulating commodity futures markets, such as oil, soy, corn, silver, and gold.
 
In the past, …
articles.title: Litecoin Dubbed A Commodity By CFTC Could Reignite Digital Silver Narrative

articles.author: Cam Thompson
articles.description: Initially proposed in April 2022, the Royal Mint's plans for an NFT are not moving forward “at this time” but the proposal will remain under review.
articles.title: UK Treasury Cancels Plans for Government-Backed NFT

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data shows the Bitcoin mining hashrate has recently registered its third-largest 3-month upwards increase in the past five years.
 
Bitcoin Mining Hashrate Has Sharply Gone Up Recently
 
As an analyst on Twitter pointed out, only the aftermaths of the 2021 China ban and the 2019 bear market saw more rapid increases. The “mining hashrate” is an indicator that measures the total amount of computing power that miners have connected to the Bitcoin blockchain.
 
When this metric’s value goes up, miners are bringing more machines online on the BTC network right now. Such a trend suggests the blockchain is currently attractive to mine for these chain validators.
 
On the other hand, the indicator’s value going down implies some miners are disconnecting their rigs from the network. This could be a…
articles.title: Bitcoin Mining Hashrate Registers Third Largest 3-Month Spike In Last 5 Years

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
The CFTC lawsuit details how the firm allegedly offered unregistered commodity derivatives to American customers.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commision has sued Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by volume, and its CEO Changpeng Zhao, alleging that the company offered the sale of unregistered derivatives to customers in the United States.
The lawsuit alleges several transgressions against CFTC regulation, including the “offering, entering into, confirming the execution of, or otherwise dealing in, off-exchange commodity futures transactions,” “operating a facility for the trading or processing of swaps without being registered as a swap execution facility (“SEF”) or designated as a contract market,” “failing to diligently supervise Binance’s activities relating to the c…
articles.title: Binance And Its CEO CZ Sued By CFTC After Alleged Regulatory Violations

articles.author: Jeff Dorman
articles.description: Extra-crypto factors retake center stage as digital assets thrive amid a banking crisis, policy response, and credibility loss for the Fed and Treasury.
articles.title: Macro Is Back to Moving the Digital Asset Markets

articles.author: Elizabeth Napolitano
articles.description: The company will distribute more than $100,000 in loan repayment refunds through its servicer to former clients, pending bankruptcy court approval.
articles.title: Bankrupt Crypto Lender BlockFi to Refund More Than $100K to California Clients

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
Amid the recent crypto market recovery, MicroStrategy, a business intelligence software company known in the crypto community for its accumulation of Bitcoin (BTC), has announced its first Bitcoin purchase of the year. 
 
Alongside its latest acquisition of Bitcoin, the software company also announced in a form 8-K filing with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that it has repaid its outstanding loan with the troubled US-based bank, Silvergate.
 
Microstrategy Resumes BTC Buying Spree After Loan Settlement
 
Microstrategy started its accumulation of Bitcoin in 2020 and ever since the company has been known for large purchases of Bitcoin. 
 
Though the company went on a three-month hiatus since its significant recorded losses in 2022, it has now resumed its BTC purch…
articles.title: Microstrategy Repays Silvergate Loan As It Expands Bitcoin Holdings

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
According to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), the troubled bank Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) was acquired by First Citizens Bank & Trust Company, which is based in Raleigh, North Carolina. First Citizens acquired all deposits and loans from SVB, as well as the 17 branches that SVB owned across the United States.
 
Silicon Valley Bank Purchased by First Citizens in FDIC-Mediated Deal
 
The FDIC has announced that First Citizens Bank has taken over Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) following the acquisition of Signature Bank by Flagstar seven days prior. According to the FDIC, as of March 10, 2023, SVB had $167 billion in total assets and approximately $119 billion in total deposits. First Citizens Bank purchased $72 billion worth of SVB’s assets “at a discount of $16.5 billion,” the F…
articles.title: First Citizens Bank Acquires Silicon Valley Bank, Costing FDIC Deposit Insurance Fund an Estimated $20B

articles.author: Jocelyn Yang
articles.description: BTC dropped to the lowest level since March 17 after the agency sued the crypto exchange for alleged regulatory violations. Binance Coin (BNB)’s price declined by 5%.
articles.title: Bitcoin Sinks Below $27K After CFTC Files Suit Against Binance

articles.author: Fran Velasquez
articles.description: If the U.S. were to design a digital dollar that protects the privacy of its users and is free of surveillance tools, it could reach mass adoption, the Digital Dollar Project co-founder said.
articles.title: Former CFTC Chair Giancarlo: A Privacy-Protecting U.S. CBDC Could ‘Take Over the World’
